item.title: Parjanya
item.description:
Source: TW

A surviving Latvian daina (chant) to the god Perkons and his sons (= H: parjanya) with a possible marutian motif in his sons

Pērkoņam seši dēli,
Visi seši Vāczemê.
Lūdziet Dievu arajiņi,
Lai nāk viens šâi zemê,
Lai nāk viens šâi zemê,
Šìs zemites trīcinàt,
Šìs zemites trīcinàt,
Šo asniņu līdzinàt.

Perkons (the thunderer) has six sons,
All six are in Germany.
Pray to the God, little plowmen,
That one comes to this land,
That one comes to this land,
To make this earth tremble,
To make this earth tremble,
To straighten these sprouts.

item.title: Smith
item.description:
Source: TW

A daina on the Latvian tvaShT^i cognate:

Kalejs kala debesîs,
Ko tas kala, ko nekala?
Dieva dēla jostu kala,
Saules meitas vaiņadziņu

The Smith forged in the heavens,
What did he forge, what did he not?
He forged a belt for the Son of the God,
A crown for the Sun’s daughter.

jostu yoktra = belt; The yoktra is the belt worn by the yajamAna-patnI in the sacrifice. It is her equivalent of the yajnopavIta.

item.title: sUryA
item.description:
Orion hunting

Source: TW

A Latvian daina showing the ancient Orion-Canis-Deer motif going back to proto-Indo-Hittite times:

Rītâ agri es redzeju
Ka Saulite medìt gāja:
Div’ sudraba kuceniņi
Apzeltitu briedi dzina.

Early in the morning, I saw
How the Little Sun went hunting:
Two silver puppies
Chased a gilded stag.

Saulite, the diminutive Sun, the hunter, evidently represents the sun in the Orion region. The two silver puppies are Canis Major and Canis Minor with Sirius and Procyon, the golden Stag is Orion: mR^igashiras.

item.title: Wind
item.description:
Source: TW

A surviving Latvian daina (chant) to the “Mother of the Wind” (Vēja māte = vAyu-mAtR^i):

Apsagrieza Vēja māte,
I vienadi, i otradi,
Dieva namu slaucidama,
Mēnestiņa istabiņu.

Mother of Vēja (Wind) turned herself,
This way and that,
Sweeping the house of the God,
The little room of the Moon.

Mēness= Moon
